comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

On the SFGate website (San Francisco Chronicle) under their entertainment/comics section, the next page link will not function in Firefox (v5.0) or any version for that matter. IE seems to work fine however. I am providing a link for this so you may check it out. You will need to set up several of your favorite comics. Recently the link to do that isn't working ether.  So you may have to set up your favorites via Microsoft IE and then check things out in Firefox.

http://www.sfgate.com

Thanks.
-M


Actual results:

Just brings up the first page of your comic selections.


Expected results:

Should go to the next page of your comic selections.

comments.text:
Tried in safe mode both with add-ons disabled and enabled and still can't link to the next comics page. Just keeps bringing up the first page. Also when I click on View Favorites just brings up the first page as well. Won't let me go to my comics check list. I am running Windows 7 64 bit. Works fine in the IE 64 browser. Very strange. Any other ideas?

-M
comments.raw_text:
Tried in safe mode both with add-ons disabled and enabled and still can't link to the next comics page. Just keeps bringing up the first page. Also when I click on View Favorites just brings up the first page as well. Won't let me go to my comics check list. I am running Windows 7 64 bit. Works fine in the IE 64 browser. Very strange. Any other ideas?

comments.raw_text:
On the console several messages. Most ! messages (Warning: Expected declaration but found '*'.  Skipped to next declaration.) 
Source File: http://imgs.sfgate.com/widgets/sitewide/css/sitewide.css
Line: 400   lots of these

Also Color, Padding, Margin, filter, -moz-opacity, etc. All ! warnings.

but a few X (Error: yld_mgr.place_ad_here is not a function
Source File: http://www.sfgate.com/comics/?feature_date=2011-07-06&page=1
Line: 164)

-M

comments.text:
Thomas Ahlblom,
Sent screen shot to email link on your name. Read subject line for location of Next Page link in question.

OK, now I can see the "Next Page" link to the right below the comic strips. I had selected too few favorites before, so they all fitted on the first page and I was clicking on the date arrows.

But even the "Next Page" links seem to work for me:

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686 (x86_64); en-US; rv:1.9.2.18) Gecko/20110614 Firefox/3.6.18
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110706 Firefox/8.0a1

As shown by the User Agent strings I'm running Linux, so hopefully someone running Windows can try reproduce this in case this is a Windows only problem.

* to get the Manage Favs Popup and change the Favs
* to click on the "Next Page" Link
* to click on the "View Favorites" Link.

Do you have any Ad Blocker and/or Security App in Usage? I had to disable my Ad Blocker to get proper Testing.

comments.raw_text: Ehhh... Forget it. To much trouble. If I want to read the comics I'll use IE. If you ever figure it out let me know. I just have to much on the table right now to keep messing around with something so trivial and that shouldn't even be. More than likely this is probably a problem between you guys and Microsoft. Thanks for your efforts.
